original_reasoning:
We are going to combine three Java programs into one Fortran program.

 Steps:
 1. The first program (codeforces_356_A) reads two integers n and q, then q queries (each: l, r, win).
    It maintains a set "left" of indices that haven't been assigned a winner (initially all indices).

        recursive subroutine build_tree(node, l, r, tree, tree_size, n, BIG)
            integer, intent(in) :: node, l, r, tree_size, n, BIG
            integer, dimension(tree_size), intent(inout) :: tree
            integer :: mid
            if (l == r) then
                tree(node) = l
            else
                mid = (l + r) / 2
                call build_tree(2*node, l, mid, tree, tree_size, n, BIG)
                call build_tree(2*node+1, mid+1, r, tree, tree_size, n, BIG)
                tree(node) = min(tree(2*node), tree(2*node+1))
            end if
        end subroutine

        recursive subroutine update_tree(node, l, r, idx, val, tree, tree_size, n, BIG)
            integer, intent(in) :: node, l, r, idx, val, tree_size, n, BIG
            integer, dimension(tree_size), intent(inout) :: tree
            integer :: mid
            if (l == r) then
                tree(node) = val
            else
                mid = (l + r) / 2
                if (idx <= mid) then
                    call update_tree(2*node, l, mid, idx, val, tree, tree_size, n, BIG)
                else
                    call update_tree(2*node+1, mid+1, r, idx, val, tree, tree_size, n, BIG)
                end if
                tree(node) = min(tree(2*node), tree(2*node+1))
            end if
        end subroutine

        recursive function query_tree(node, l, r, ql, qr, tree, tree_size, n, BIG) result(res)
            integer, intent(in) :: node, l, r, ql, qr, tree_size, n, BIG
            integer, dimension(tree_size), intent(in) :: tree
            integer :: res
            integer :: mid, left_res, right_res
            if (r < ql .or. qr < l) then
                res = BIG
            else if (ql <= l .and. r <= qr) then
                res = tree(node)
            else
                mid = (l + r) / 2
                left_res = query_tree(2*node, l, mid, ql, qr, tree, tree_size, n, BIG)
                right_res = query_tree(2*node+1, mid+1, r, ql, qr, tree, tree_size, n, BIG)
                res = min(left_res, right_res)
            end if
        end function
